definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
voices unanimous in praise (idiom); with an extensive public reputation

sentences.english: He has received so much public praise.
sentences.chinese: 他受到大家的交口稱讚。

sentences.english: This year's auto exhibition received unanimous acclaim.
sentences.chinese: 本屆車展受到參觀者交口稱讚。

sentences.english: Lude also once wrong declared me Qiao Jie for several times.
sentences.chinese: 橋傑教授？路德也曾數次錯口稱我橋傑。

sentences.english: The guests went into rhapsodies over the food.
And that every tongue should confess that Jesus Christ is Lord, to the glory of God the Father.
sentences.chinese: 無不口稱耶穌基督爲主，使榮耀歸與父神。

sentences.english: Praises were heaped on him after the game.
sentences.chinese: 比賽結束後，人們對他交口稱讚。

sentences.english: Every person stood to applaud his unforgettable act of courage.
sentences.chinese: 大家都起身對他令人難忘的英勇之舉交口稱讚。

sentences.english: Though they extol the virtues of the peaceful life.
sentences.chinese: 儘管他們都交口稱讚寧靜的鄉村生活的種種優點。

sentences.english: Bear was totally blown away by this.
sentences.chinese: 熊完全交口稱讚這一點。
